2:
"No doubt you are the people;\q wisdom will die with you.
\q
3:
But I have understanding as well as you;\q I am not inferior to you.
\q Indeed, who does not know such things as these?


\q
4:
I am something for my neighbor to laugh at—\q I, one who called on God and who was answered by him!
\q I, a just and blameless man—I am now something to laugh at.
\q
5:
In the thought of someone who is at ease, there is contempt for misfortune;\q he thinks in a way that brings more misfortune to those whose foot is slipping.
\q
7:
But now ask the beasts, and they will teach you;\q ask the birds of the heavens, and they will tell you.
\q
8:
Or speak to the earth, and it will teach you;\q the fish of the sea will declare to you.


\q
9:
Which animal among all these does not know\q that the hand of Yahweh has done this?
\q
10:
In his hand is the life of every living thing\q and the breath of all mankind.


\q
11:
Does not the ear test words\q just as the palate tastes its food?
\q
12:
With aged men is wisdom;\q in length of days is understanding.


\q
13:
With God are wisdom and might;\q he has counsel and understanding.
\q
14:
See, he breaks down, and it cannot be built again;\q if he imprisons someone, there can be no release.
\q
15:
See, if he withholds the waters, they dry up;\q and if he sends them out, they overwhelm the land.


\q
16:
With him are strength and wisdom;\q people who are deceived and the deceiver are both in his power.
\q
17:
He leads counselors away barefoot in sorrow;\q he turns judges into fools.
\q
18:
He takes off the chain of authority from kings;\q he wraps a cloth about their waists.


\q
19:
He leads priests away barefoot in sorrow\q and overthrows mighty people.
\q
20:
He removes the speech of those who had been trusted\q and takes away the understanding of the elders.
\q
21:
He pours contempt upon princes\q and unfastens the belt of strong people.


\q
22:
He reveals the deep things of darkness\q and brings deep shadows into the light.
\q
23:
He makes nations strong, and he also destroys them;\q He enlarges nations, and he also leads them along as prisoners.


\q
24:
He takes away understanding from the leaders of the people of the earth;\q he causes them to wander in a wilderness where there is no path.
\q
25: They grope in the dark without light;\q he makes them stagger like a drunk man.
